histore.key module¶

Base classes for row key values.

class histore.key.KeyValue(value=None)¶

Bases: object

Abstract base class for key values. We currently distinguish four types of key values: numeric, string, None, and new rows. The distinction between None and new rows is of importance for documents that are keyed by a list of numeric row index values. In that case, non-numeric or negative values are considered new rows that are assigned row identifier during the merge process.

Supclasses primarily implement comparison operators for sorting. The general sort order is: numeric, string, null, new

is_new()¶

Test if the key represents a new row.

Return type

bool

Test if the key represents a null value (None).

Returns

Return type

class histore.key.NewRow(identifier=None)¶

Bases: histore.key.KeyValue

Key for new document rows in documents that are keyed by the row index. Having a dedicated object for these type of keys allows to distinguish betweeen primary key values that are None and the new rows.

class histore.key.NullKey(identifier=None)¶

Bases: histore.key.KeyValue

Object for key values that are None.

class histore.key.NumberKey(value)¶

Bases: histore.key.KeyValue

Object for numeric key values.

class histore.key.StringKey(value)¶

Bases: histore.key.KeyValue

Object for string key values.
